Pre-Game Insights: Ireland will play their third game of the T20 World Cup 2024 against United States of America on Friday in Florida.
It is a huge game for the Irish side who have lost both their encounters so far.
Paul Stirling and his team have a huge mountain to climb if they have to make it to the Super 8 stages.
Ireland needs to beat the high-flying United States of America and hope for an Indian win over Canada, and then beat Pakistan in their final match on Sunday.
Ireland's campaign began with a huge loss to India, where they were bowled out for a meagre 96.
Ireland suffered a shock loss to Canada, leaving them in troubled waters.
Andrew Balbirnie has suddenly lost his form with the bat and skipper Paul Stirling too is struggling for runs.
Lorcan Tucker and Harry Tector are touted as the next best players to come out of Ireland.
Curtis Campher is a decent hitter of the ball and can bowl effectively.
George Dockrell is not only an able batter but also the lead spinner.
Gareth Delaney showed his talent with the bat against India.
Joshua Little, the lead pacer, can generate good speeds and bowl a good bouncer.
Mark Adair has been impressing everyone with his steady bowling and is also capable with the bat.
Barry McCarthy and Craig Young have been delivering wickets at regular intervals for their side.
